thread.title: Assistant football coach shot to death in nightclub shooting
thread.title_full: Assistant football coach shot to death in nightclub shooting

title: Assistant football coach shot to death in nightclub shooting
text:
Assistant football coach shot to death in nightclub shooting By - Associated Press - Thursday, October 22, 2015 
MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) - Police have identified a man gunned down at a Montgomery nightclub as 41-year-old Tracy Edwards, a volunteer coach for the Prattville High School freshman football team. 
Montgomery police say the shooting happened around 3:45 a.m. Wednesday at Club Big Boyz on the city’s west side. A second man was injured but is expected to survive. 
As of Wednesday night, no arrests had been made. 
Antonio “Bam” Richards, offensive coordinator for the Prattville High football team, told The Montgomery Advertiser (http://on.mgmadv.com/1RqeG4b) that this year was Edwards’ first year as an assistant coach for the freshman team. Richards said he coached receivers. 
Richards said Edwards “believed in being involved in kids’ lives.” 
___ 
Information from: Montgomery Advertiser, http://www.montgomeryadvertiser.com
